alert.note: Alert for Ferry; Okanogan; Pend Oreille; Stevens (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 09 at 9:55AM PDT until June 09 at 4:45PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of North Idaho, including the following counties, Benewah, Bonner, Boundary, Kootenai, Latah and Shoshone. Portions of Washington, including the following counties, Ferry, Okanogan, Pend Oreille and Stevens. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Burn scars in steep terrain will be susceptable to flash flooding. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Another round of thunderstorms is expected during Friday afternoon. These storms again pose potential for heavy downpours and flash flooding especially over burn scars in the area. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
